subject: Monday Night Football
event:
Historically the Giants have usually sucked on Monday nights, so tonight's victory over Atlanta came as a relief.  The Falcons are a wounded, troubled team, mind you, but even so, the G-Men scored a convincing win.  For the first time all season, their offense and defense both showed up at the same game.

And congratulations to Amani Toomer, who broke one Giants all-time record tonight (Tiki Barber's record for receptions) and tied another one (Kyle Rote's touchdown mark).  A class guy, and he's been a clutch receiver for a long time.

So the G-Men are 4-2... again.  (They were 4-2 the last three seasons as well.  They like to get our hopes up before they collapse and break our hearts in the second half of the season, but maybe this year will be different).

On other fronts, Parris is on the mend, even hobbling about the house without Father's crutch from time to time.  We head down to Albuquerque tomorrow so she can get her stitches removed.

comments.article: Congrats on the big win! It's nice that your Giants fared better than my Seahawks!
I agree our seahawks have gone into a spiral of doom

comments.upictitle: move along, nothing to see here.: splendor
comments.article: I wish Parris the best of luck! <3 <3

That game was a lot of fun to watch. They aren't my teams, but I had one flag flying for Atlanta, cause black uniforms are sweet and cause Harrington, though shit, was a big guy for Oregon; and the other cause I wanted a happy football post from you.

A lot of action, some awesome athletic plays, and some good emotion.
How goes the writing? Not being facetious here.
You may want to read the archived posts regarding his writing.  They are pretty self explanatory...

And in other news, the Dolphins falls to 0-6. Glug. Hurricanes aren't so hot, either, but I'm getting used to this.

I think the Giants will take San Francisco, but I'm not sure on the Jets and Bengals to be honest.

The G's did great!

I know how having a bad leg can be. I'm all iced up myself. All my best to Parris.

comments.article:
glad to hear that Parris is feeling better already.
best wishes to you and your lady. ^^
Yay for Parris. Hope her progress continues for a speedy (and painless) recovery.

comments.upictitle: The Faery Of Dark Despair: Om
comments.article:
We live in Georgia where if you aren't a falcons fan or a Dawgs fan *gasp!* then you're CRAZY. Of course we aren't. My husband loves the Buckeyes and I like the buccaneers because they have a pirate ship. :) What can I say? I prefer Hockey. It holds my attention and I don't find myself cheering for the wrong team. Boy is THAT embarrassing. Maybe that's why my husband stopped taking me to football games.
YAY stitches out YAY!!!
Oh, I don't know.  There's a pretty sizable Texas Longhorns contingent out here.  But then, we're like roaches that way.  We can happily congregate in any state and claim we're the best.  :)
Being that I am a Giants fan living in GA I must tread carefully today at work.  ;)
I agree 100% about Amani Toomer. A true class act.

Not to change the subject, but what was up with the Jet's uniforms on Saturday? I think they must have lost their actual duds in a washing mishap, so they had to borrow a local high school's old uniforms.

Can hardly blame them for losing.

TM
Guess you've never heard of the one game a year all the teams get to play in their throwback jerseys from yesteryear? Its actually kind of fun when they switch it up for that one game...

I'm curious as to the meaning of the statement "Historically they have usually sucked on Monday nights." Not about what it means, but why would this be a factor they could control? It seems like a coincidence to me.

Sometimes I think Eli should just throw interceptions for the last play of every half just to get them out of his system. They could even design a play for it- up the middle, throw to an defender in the middle of three Giants. JUst a thought.

So, what does it say about either Toomer or the state of Giants' quarterbacking over recent years that he just now, as a WR who's been with NY for what seems like forever, is passing up a RB, even an exceptional one like Barber, for total receptions?

I love me the check-down pass like anyone, but... wow.

I am glad Paris is healing well. I hope her recovery continues to go smoothly. I'm glad her stitches are coming out and all is well. My best to both of you.

I've always been a Packers fan, through all the lean years in the 80s and early 90s, then the winning years and then the not so great years again. This season has pleased me so far. Except the whole loss to the Bears at home last week. Some of that was bad calls I think. But a lot of it was bad plays. My point, however, (this cold medicine is making me have a hard time maintaining a point) is that this season has been much more interesting for me because I'm always looking (or watching if we should get an actual game televised) for how the Giants and the Jets did. Also, how some other teams did or didn't do. It has made it even more fun.

Go Niners, Go Niners, Go Niners....

Sorry GRRM, but I think THIS IS THE GAME!

Loving Storm of Swords. Thanks for actually NOT killing off B and R at WF.

In the middle of Storm of Swords... I don't know whether I should envy your candid optimism... or pity you for events yet to come!

Enjoy the read.

The Seahawks broke our hearts this week. It was terrible to watch them.

Give my best to Parris; hope she's healing up beautifully. I go in for Transplant Class tomorrow.
I know nothing of football, but I am glad Parris is feeling better.

I'm glad Parris is feeling better.

As for the Giants--you cheer for the wrong ones. The correct Giants are located in San Francisco.*

As far as football goes, my Niners may be in for a rough Sunday in the Meadowlands. Damn your Formidable Front Four!(tm) They are going to make our anemic offensive line look, well, anemic. O where art thou, Steve Young?

Will
Have faith Will of Argyle...  A victory is in the cards.  Indeed, an upset.
O.o
comments.subject: Re: Update on Writing

comments.article:
Well... getting back to the subject at hand (football) after that positive note regarding Mr. Martin from the above poster...

The stat from last night's game that amazed me the most is that Eli to Plaxico is currently tied with Brady to Moss for the most TD receptions this year and over the course of the last two seasons and the first six of this year, Manning-Burress is actually tied with Manning-Harrison for first in the league. Stunned. Absolutely stunned when I heard that.

I also was surprised with the stat that 11 straight completions was a career high for Eli. I remember when Ole Miss played my woefully overmatched Murray State Racers during Eli's sophomore year and he set the NCAA record for consecutive completions.

(PS For the record... I think you're a pretty good writer, and I've never had a problem with ASoIaF t-shirts.)
comments.subject: Eli to Plaxico

comments.article:
You shouldn't be surprised. In college, it's easy to look great. Ron Dayne. I've seen only a few plays of Eli in college. I believe it was his "draft tape". Most of the so-called great passes were really great catches. Great catches are made easier against weak defenses which we all know are rampant in the college game.

Those stats for TD tandems are really just novelties. Completion percentages and total TDs vs interceptions, now those are important stats. The caveat especially for college QBs is who was the competition.
comments.subject: Re: Eli to Plaxico

comments.article: Glad to hear Parris is recovering nicely.  Wish I could say the same about the Chiefs.

I am most certainly out of shape, and I'm pretty sure my hat looks stupid on my head.

However, I could certainly use a lot of money, working from home, living how I want where I want, AND an NFL team with a winning record!

sergawain you ignorant twit... Mr. Martin is WORKING ON THE TV ADAPTATION! You sound like a very poor and jealous troll.

Makes me wonder what you would say about Robert Jordan not being able to finish his series.

As far as Jordans series goes, its a perfect example of an ego tanking an entire series. I think that most of us pretend books 5-11 never happened, sort of like Godfather 3, Alien 3, and Rocky 5 never happened.

That being said, RIP Robert Jordan, he did give us 4 great books.
